results.title: Early metformin therapy (age 8-12 years) in girls with precocious pubarche to reduce hirsutism, androgen excess, and oligomenorrhea in adolescence.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: In @<m>DISEASE_Microcephalic_osteodysplastic_primordial_dwarfism_type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C537577 @@@LBW-PP@@@ girls, early @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ therapy was found to prevent or delay the development of @DISEASE_Hirsutism @DISEASE_MESH:D006628 @@@hirsutism@@@, @DISEASE_Virilism @DISEASE_MESH:D014770 @@@androgen excess@@@, @DISEASE_Oligomenorrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D009839 @@@oligomenorrhea@@@, and @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@ more effectively than late @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Ibáñez L, López-Bermejo A, Díaz M, Marcos MV, de Zegher F. Early metformin therapy (age 8-12 years) in girls with precocious pubarche to reduce hirsutism, androgen excess, and oligomenorrhea in adolescence. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 2011 Aug;96(8):E1262-7. PMID: 21632811
